javatools.administrative

Class Tracer

  • java.lang.Object
    • javatools.administrative.Tracer

  • public class Tracer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is part of the Java Tools (see http://mpii.de/yago-naga/javatools). It is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution License (see http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0) by the YAGO-NAGA team (see http://mpii.de/yago-naga). This class allows to trace where a program hangs. Use as follows: 
      Before calling a method in your program, call Tracer.signal():
      Tracer.signal("Calling blah");
  In your main method, state
      Tracer.start(number of milliseconds);

  Whenever the tracer does not receive a signal for the given number of milliseconds,
  it writes a warning, such as e.g.
     Calling blah hangs
  When it receives the next signal, it will say
     Hang resolved
    Use the tracer for debugging purposes only.

    • Field Detail

      • tracer

        protected static Tracer.TracerThread tracer

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tracer

        public Tracer()

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public static boolean start(long millisDelay)
        Start the tracer, accept millisDelay milliseconds between two signals before issuing a warning. Returns TRUE so that it can be used in an assert statement

      • stop

        public static void stop()
        Stop the tracer

      • signal

        public static boolean signal(java.lang.Object... s)
        Send a signal to the tracer. Always returns TRUE so that it can be used in assert

      • test1

        public static void test1()
        Sleeps for 2 seconds. Tracer will not say anything

      • test2

        public static void test2()
        Sleeps for 5 seconds. Tracer will write a warning

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Calls test1 and test2 in a loop. Tracer will complain whenever some call takes longer than 3 seconds
